intro: Canthium abbreviatum, commonly known as the short-stalked spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and alternate leaves. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cup-like structures called cyathia. Canthium abbreviatum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
